titleStmt.title: The Confession and execution of the five prisoners suffering at Tyburn on Fryday the 16th of March, 1676/7 viz, Thomas Sadler and William Johnson [brace] for a burglary in the house of the Right Honourable the Lord High Chancellor of England, and stealing the mace and two purses : and Francis Webb [brace] for a burglary, and stealing of clothes of great value, Matthew Gammond and Anthony Richoake [brace] for a burglary in Clarkenwel : together with their penitent behaviour in Newgate, since their condemnation, and last speeches at the place of execution.

The Confession and execution of the five prisoners suffering at Tyburn on Fryday the 16th of March, 1676/7 viz, Thomas Sadler and William Johnson [brace] for a burglary in the house of the Right Honourable the Lord High Chancellor of England, and stealing the mace and two purses : and Francis Webb [brace] for a burglary, and stealing of clothes of great value, Matthew Gammond and Anthony Richoake [brace] for a burglary in Clarkenwel : together with their penitent behaviour in Newgate, since their condemnation, and last speeches at the place of execution.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
